alert.note: Alert for Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:43PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts...New Hampshire... Merrimack River AT Lawrence affecting Essex County. Merrimack River At Lowell affecting Middlesex and Essex Counties. Spicket River Near Methuen affecting Rockingham and Essex Counties. For the Merrimack River...including Lowell, Lawrence...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Spicket River...including Methuen...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merrimack River at Lawrence. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Lowland flooding is expected along the Merrimack River near Lawrence. This will affect some businesses and associated parking lots along the river. Backwater flooding along the Shawsheen River may result in flood impacts along lower Glenwood Street in North Andover, as well as businesses on Route 114 on the Lawrence-North Andover town line that are adjacent to the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 20.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 24.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 27.1 feet tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
